Commands for managing roles.

IServiceProvider services

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

CreateRole(string?)

Creates a new role with the specified name.

Declaration
[Cmd("CreateRole")]
[Aliases("CreateRole")]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[UserPerm(GuildPermission.ManageRoles)]
[BotPerm(GuildPermission.ManageRoles)]
public Task CreateRole(string? roleName = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string roleName

The name of the role to create.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task representing the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

This command allows administrators to create a new role with the specified name. It requires the Manage Roles permission for the user.

| Edit this page View Source

ReactionRoles(Exclude, params string[])

Assigns reaction roles based on the provided input, excluding certain roles.

Declaration
[Cmd("ReactionRoles")]
[Aliases("ReactionRoles")]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[UserPerm(GuildPermission.ManageRoles)]
[BotPerm(GuildPermission.ManageRoles)]
[Priority(1)]
public Task ReactionRoles(Administration.RoleCommands.Exclude _, params string[] input)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Administration.RoleCommands.Exclude _
string[] input

The roles and emojis to be associated with reactions.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task representing the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

This command allows administrators to manage reaction roles in the server while making all roles exclusive. It requires the Manage Roles permission for the user and the Manage Roles permission for the bot.

| Edit this page View Source

ReactionRoles(Exclude, ulong, params string[])

Assigns reaction roles based on the provided input, excluding certain roles.

Declaration

Parameters
Type Name Description
Administration.RoleCommands.Exclude _

Exclusion parameter (ignored).

The ID of the message to which reactions will be added.
string[] input

The roles and emojis to be associated with reactions.
Returns
Type Description

Remarks

Parameters
Type Name Description
IGuildUser user

The user from whom to remove all roles.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task representing the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

This command allows administrators to remove all roles from a specified user except managed roles and the everyone role. It requires the Manage Roles permission for the user.
